column2: Request sanction to wage a Holy War from our head of religion. If granted, this will allow us to wage a Holy War without losing piety. A high piety and good relations will increase the chance of sanction being granted.
Revoke this character's honorary title and the prestige and income that goes along with it. This will anger them.
The base number of troops we can raise from our vassals depends on the §Ynumber of holdings§! in the realm. A larger realm can raise fewer troops per vassal.
Follows a traditional religion of the Byzantine Empire\n
This character presumes to decide over the affairs of the church despite being a temporal ruler. This attitude could be seen as borderline heretical.
You or the Pope §Yfully control§! Rome and the temple holder is not a heretic\n
You must be either a §Yreformed Pagan§! or a member of any §Ynon-pagan religion group§!\n
Although not the legal ruler, this character holds all the real power.
The promise of victory raises the morale of our warriors\n
The promise of wealth reinvigorates trade in our lands\n
This woman is more comfortable in male clothing.
This woman is more comfortable in male clothing.
The character is the head of what is seen as a small and vigorous dynasty, one still untouched by corruption and decadence.
The current war allows us to call on additional troops from our vassals.
Your indecisive allegiance to multiple rivaling factions is not well-regarded among your peers.
Succession laws will become available in a few weeks of game time.
Can not form the Holy Roman Empire\n
Israel has a right to defend itself!
This character resents being ruled by a liege who has no natural rights to their land.
This character is planning a Grand Banquet that will impress friends and foe alike.
Expel the Jews living in our lands and seize their wealth for the crown.
The current rebellion originated in this province. Perhaps once the war is over, matters there should be dealt with more directly...
This character has recently been in a civil war, and their vassals are unlikely to start another for some time.
There are benefits to a happy wife...
The laws of the realm allow this title\n
Our relatively low rank gives us better control over our local vassals, who will supply us with more troops.
A ruler, to the exclusion of all else.
Reigning in a province that does not follow the true faith makes administration of your territories difficult.
Reigning in a province that does not follow the true faith makes administration of your territories difficult.
This character will leave your court, along with their family (spouse and children), unless they're members of your dynasty, close relatives, spouse or consort.
